notesStmt.note: Incomplete at the end. Folio 2 damaged. Stained. Slightly water-damaged.
Folios 316v and 317r contain a short treatise written in an Italian cursive script.Two Latin inscriptions, folios 1v and [320r].
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msContents.summary: Pisḳe halakhot, of Isaiah of Trani, the younger, on several tractates of Talmud..

msItem.title: Hilkhot tsitsit, tefilin, mezuzah, sefer Torah

collation.p: 32 quires: i-xxiv11 (folios 1-240); xxv12 (folios 241-152); xxvi-xxxi10 (folios 253-312); xxxii6-1 (folios 313-317). Marked by catchwords at the end of the quires and Hebrew letters at the beginning of the quires (mostly cut away).

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script of the 14th to 15th century. Eliyah ben Shemu'el: inscribed in a rhyme, folio 105r.

binding.p: BM in-house. Spine title: 'Isaiah of Trani. Pesakim. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Oriental 3613.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: David Schifmann of Tiberias: bought from him by the British Museum on 20 October 1888: inscribed (folio [321v].
